fields.description: Probably not always but frequently enough changes to existing subrepos of a Mercurial repository (which changes are recorded in the .hgsubstate file by Mercurial) don't show up in a PR of the parent repo, the PR is just empty. The change however is really there in the branch, it's really a diff to the target branch.
fields.summary: Mercurial subrepo (.hgsubstate) changes don't always show up in PR diff

Put API call Returning an HTTP error of 400

fields.description:
Bitbucket resolves HEAD to the commit-ID and adds that to all followup links on the entry page of a repository. That enforces that you stay on the same commit when clicking around, and I get that this does have a benefit, too, but it's not what you usually want nor expect at least for wikis.

Some people call that perma-linking, but a perma-link in blogs also only permanently refers to a particular post, not a particular version of it.

Having URLs for particular versions is certainly a good thing, but I think it should not be what you get by default. People will hit reload and not see the change, or people will publish such links and people visiting them will get stale content without realizing.

So, all of this is my analysis (while checking if Bitbucket is suitable for us as a wiki), and call it theoretical, but I really wonder whether whoever decided to put commit-IDs into the URLs by default didn't also do it purely on theoretical grounds.

I'm proposing one or multiple of these changes:

* link without commit ID by default (it's probably a good idea to still provide a link on each page to get the same page tied to the current commit ID in the HEAD)
* optionally add a per-repository setting to select which behaviour (with or without commit ID) should be the default
* when formatting a page for a URL _with_ commit id, add a flashy marker to the top of the page that says "this page has been modified. [reload the newest version]" with the link or button going to the newest version (either newly resolved commit ID in the URL, or no commit ID). Care should be taken so that if you scrolls down, then hit reload, you still get to see this notification somehow (make the marker stick to the top of the window instead of the page? Use JavaScript and floating notification instead?)

I get that linking to a particular commit has the nice advantage that it will always find the page (it could have been deleted or moved for newer commits); to keep this advantage, you could track renames (git already has that functionality, you'd have to parse it and build a searchable (and perhaps incrementally updatable) data structure out of it). It may be useful to actually keep the commit-ID in the URLs and go with the notification approach suggested above.

I think the current behaviour is rather problematic for wikis, so I leave the priority at major: we will likely move our wiki elsewhere once more than 2-3 devs uses it (unless the behaviour has changed in the mean time).
fields.summary: Commit-ID in URLs by default is probably a bad idea (at least for wikis)

Hi,

The above repository is showing as unavailable, I guess the import failed. Can you delete it please.

Thanks\\
Joel
fields.summary: Repository Unavailable

fields.description:
Currently users depend on the administrators to manage access to repositories and teams.\\
This includes leaving, or giving up access to a repository or team.\\
In many cases you want to be able stop your own access in order to guarantee governance where the administrators of the repository are failing.\\
The only user that would not be able to leave would be the master, that should also be the one to be able to delete the repository.
fields.summary: Allow users to leave Teams and Repositories on their own

fields.description:
When a bitbucket user is mentioned in an issue or is watching a repository/Pull Request, an e-mail is sent to that user.
When that user replies to the e-mail, the content is lost since as it is not added to the issue or pull request comments.

The "from" address is {{noreply@bitbucket.org}} but the name of commenter is used in the {{from}} field. 
Due to that information being displayed on the summary of the email, we would expect to be able to reply to it, adding comments to the mentioned issue/pull request.

Would it be possible to add this functionality to Bitbucket as it would assist us to:
# Keep comments up-to-date easily
# Reply using a mobile device
# Make it easy to reply in case 2FA is active
fields.summary: Reply to Bitbucket notifications via email does not add changes to Bitbucket

fields.description: On [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/resolve-issues-automatically-when-users-push-code-221451126.html] appears the pseudo-sentence "You should always include the # (pound sign or hash mark) if you to ensure that links back to the issue resolve." It appears the word "want" is itself wanting between "you" and "to."
fields.summary: Slightly garbled sentence in the issue tracker documentation

fields.description:
Hi,

We want to streamline the boot of our docker image and have inserted a startup.sh file on our docker image that at startup time launches services like REDIS / MONGODB and APACHE.

As far as we can now see the problem is that startup.sh is never executed since pipelines create an ENTRYPOINT and bash file for the compiled bitbucket-pipeline.yml instructions and then executes this bash file when starting the container.

MongoDB can then only be executed via a --fork, as a service. So it will not freeze the bash script. It works.. but booting up a docker container then takes an extra 5 minutes before other bash commands can be executed.

Its a working work around.. but is it possible that the CMD in the docker container is executed first? Or does that create more problems on your end?

Kind regards,

Gerhard Richard Edens
fields.summary: CMD not executed at startup docker image

fields.description:
Add support for keyword in commit message.

For example:\\
PPLN_IGNORE. Commit message...\\
Command for pipeline to ignore this commit.

Or maybe add more flexibility and send any arguments from commit message to control flow of deploy/build scripts.

For example:\\
PPLN_SMITH. Commit message...\\
Extract custom arguments 'SMITH' and assign it to environment variable. Deploy scripts use this variable and deploy this build only for Smith.
fields.summary: Add command in commit message to ignore building commit in Pipelines (skip ci)

fields.description: Add BITBUCKET_COMMIT_MSG environment variable to add info about changes in build.
fields.summary: Add BITBUCKET_COMMIT_MSG environment variable

fields.description:
There's a bunch of spam bots posting issues.  I'd like to be able to mark them for review by Atlassian staff to have them and their creators destroyed

eg\\
https://bitbucket.org/jarkylee123/\\
https://bitbucket.org/sonokumari/\\
https://bitbucket.org/fdgtrdhyujy/
fields.summary: Button to mark users as spam

fields.description:
I had pulled EionRobb/purple-hangouts and pushed it to rw_grim/purple-hangouts to bring it into sync before starting some work.  Unfortunately commit https://bitbucket.org/rw_grim/purple-hangouts/commits/a41e3e31f195c5470dc7193c2e4a2b178efcbbdb has an @mention in it that notified the person via email.  I should also note that the person that was @metion'd is _NOT_ following my fork.

I'm not sure what the correct solution here is since this could be a useful feature and as such would be difficult to determine when to fire it.  Right now it seems like always, which means you could get as many notifications as there are forks, and that sounds like a lot of email to cleanup for something silly.
fields.summary: Forks notify users that are mentioned in commit messages

fields.description:
The syntax highlighting for Matlab/Octave language does not appear to function correctly. You can easily reproduce this adding the following code on Bitbucket and save that as octave/matlab extension.

isOctave = (exist ('OCTAVE_VERSION', 'builtin') > 0);\\
if isOctave\\
pkg load nurbs; % for Octave\\
end

The syntaxy highlighting should appears like this:\\
http://pygments.org/demo/5749081/
fields.summary: Matlab/Octave Syntax Highlighting (BB-16179)

fields.description:
The administrator task has many different permissions. Many of those are used in the team. However the admin role can delete the repository, including the evidence of the person deleting.\\
I would like to maintain Team members in the admin role, but to have a way to guarantee the repository history in a way the admin role cannot destroy.\\
Being able to sync, back up, or something in those lines would be good for us.
fields.summary: I need to assure administrators of repositories of our company are not able to destroy the repository history

fields.description:
Roughly a week ago, I started to get an error message whenever I do git pull/push/fetch: 'no matching cipher found'. But if I keep repeating the action, I'd get through. It only happens on my dev station (MacBook Pro). I haven't encountered it on any other machines.

Here's the log for "git -Tv" when the error happens:\\
OpenSSH_6.9p1, LibreSSL 2.1.8\\
debug1: Reading configuration data /Users/dev1/.ssh/config\\
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config\\
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 21: Applying options for *\\
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [104.192.143.1] port 22.\\
debug1: Connection established.\\
debug1: identity file /Users/dev1/.ssh/id_rsa type 1\\
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory\\
debug1: identity file /Users/dev1/.ssh/id_rsa-cert type -1\\
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0\\
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.9\\
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version conker_1.0.200.d286c99\\
debug1: no match: conker_1.0.200.d286c99\\
debug1: Authenticating to bitbucket.org:22 as 'git'\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent\\
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received\\
ssh_dispatch_run_fatal: Connection to 104.192.143.1: no matching cipher found

Look forward to your advise.\\
Cheers
fields.summary: No matching cipher found

fields.description: Some pull requests can be quite complicated and span many files.  In these cases I find it useful to review file by file in Diff mode before approving the pull request.  The problem with this is when reviewing over time, or in a very distracting environment, its easy to forget which files I have already reviewed.  Using comments I can sort of accomplish this but it would be nice to have an approve file option in Diff mode for my own tracking.  This would have no impact on the pull request itself.  After approving every file, Bitbucket could possibly show a modal asking if I want to approve the pull request, however other than that no changes to pull request approvals would be needed.
fields.summary: Add approve by file in Diff mode for pull requests

fields.summary: TeamCity integration not working properly with the Bitbucket Cloud platform. (BB-16173)

fields.description:
Feature request.

We use a rebase method and while we can disable history re-writes and prevent any commits from being deleted, there is no option to disable merges. That is something that is forbidden in our guidelines, but unfortunately many juniors don't know how to use git properly per our workflow and eff up our repos this automatic merges. For us, this is a major problem that we cannot block it and atm I am the only one with the power and knowledge to undo their changes. However sometimes they are so extensive there is no turning back...
fields.summary: Bitbucket setting to disable merge commits

fields.description: You can create a mercurial pull request which targets a bookmark but the reviewer is not given any indication what the target bookmark is. This is very confusing for the reviewer.
fields.summary: Pull requests do not display target bookmark

so please forward if necessary. The login problem I'm experiencing, from at least 23:00 UTC 9 Jul 2016 until now (~= 00:30 UTC 10 Jul 2016) is

# I goto http://my.atlassian.com/ to login
# I get forwarded to the login page https://id.atlassian.com/login?application=mac&continue=https://my.atlassian.com
# I enter my credentials, then click button='Log in'
# I get a page with the same URI as above, containing only the following text:

{{Invalid CSRF token found in form body}}

Please help!
fields.summary: Atlassian login -> 'Invalid CSRF token found in form body'

fields.description:
Roughly since 2016 jul 06 I experience more and more common authentication issues when trying to connect to bitbucket server over ssh.

The problem is that the server closes the connection without any notice when my private key is offered. When retrying on the same server I randomly succeed or fail

Maybe it's important, that I'm using an Aladdin eToken to store and sign requests with an RSA key.

I've attached two ssh logs one with the error another with a success. For the logging I've used an ip address to be sure I connect to the same ip, but I can reproduce the error on any of the public ips.
fields.summary: ssh authentication issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Bitbucket Cloud, if you specify a FishEye/Crucible Service in a repository setting, Bitbucket Cloud uses a deprecated URL of _/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories-v1/<SVN-REPOSITORY-NAME>/scan_. This should be _/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories/<SVN-REPOSITORY-NAME>/incremental-index_.

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket Cloud should use the _/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories/<SVN-REPOSITORY-NAME>/incremental-index_ endpoint.

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket Cloud uses the _/rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories-v1/<SVN-REPOSITORY-NAME>/scan_ endpoint.
fields.summary: FishEye/Crucible Service Uses Deprecated Endpoint (BB-16171)

fields.description:
When creating a repository for a team (owner), a project needs to be selected.

Would it be possible to a) allow the name of the project to be inputted/typed (with auto suggest) for quick selection and b) list the suggested projects alphabetically?

Currently, after clicking on the Project select menu, the list of projects returned is not alphabetical; in addition, it is not clear how much scrolling is required to find the desired project (especially if there are many projects).
fields.summary: Project Selection When Creating a New Repository for a Team

fields.description:
It would be nice to have an environment variable that could point directly to the build result.\\
Not that hard to figure out how to create one but would be useful for many 3rd party integrations (or something so easy as a curl Slack post to notify with a link back to the build).

Somewhat releated: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/12826
fields.summary: Add BITBUCKET environment variable for URL to the build

fields.description:
Let's face it, YML is not a friendly format. Indentation hell between a teams editors alone is costing us.

You should support JSON, and see how many end up using YML after a while.
fields.summary: Support for JSON config
Some pipelines steps dont have log ranges causing the UI to render them incorrectly.

fields.description:
Pipelines has a timeout of 2 hours for builds.

Currently if your build times out the logs are not retrieved in the UI, which would allow you to debug why your build was taking so long.
fields.summary: Logs are not retrieved if the build is errored due to timeout.

fields.description: When downloading logs for further analysis (or just trying to quickly skim in a text editor), the ansi escape codes can make further analysis more complicated, and then we need to pipe all the logs through a utility to remove them.  Would be very helpful to have an option to strip them out.
fields.summary: Download raw log without ansi escape codes

fields.description: Would be nice to automatically decline a PR on the event of a build failure/test failure/code coverage failure.
fields.summary: Option to decline PR on build failure

fields.description:
h3. Summary
'Enable Pipelines' checkbox in repository Pipelines Settings is not visible from Firefox

h3. Environment
Tested with Firefox 47.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Sign up for Bitbucket Pipelines
# After you are granted access, open a repo under your account with Firefox
# Go to _Pipelines_ from the sidebar
# Select _Set up Pipelines_

h3. Expected Results
Pipelines Settings page opens, with the option to enable Pipelines for the repo:

!926393336-Screen%20Shot%202016-07-05%20at%2014.44.50.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The 'Enable Pipelines' checkbox is missing in Firefox:

!2953713115-Screen%20Shot%202016-07-05%20at%2014.44.39.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Use Chrome instead
fields.summary: 'Enable Pipelines' checkbox in repository Settings is not visible from Firefox (BB-16167)

fields.description:
Hi,

We're using the diff view of a branch for a code review.\\
I was wondering if it's possible to add a link to the branch page from within the commit page.\\
Now when you mention the issue name in the commit message, you'll be taken to Jira and when you press the "hotfix/..."-link, you'll be taken to an overview of all commits.\\
We'd like to see a button to direct-link to the page where we could see the diff-view of the current branch in which the commit has been made.
fields.summary: Link to branch-page from within commit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When triggers the Component/Assignee filter in the Repository Issue page (not in Advance Search), the redirected URL is included with _&page=<current issue page number>_.\\
If the _<current issue page number>_ is larger than the total of filtered component/assignee pages, Bitbucket Cloud returns Error 404

###Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to Repository *Issue*
# Navigate to any issue page _except the first page_
# Click any _Component_/_Assignee_ which located at the same row as the issue ticket

###Expected Results\\
Redirects to:\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repository>/issues?status=new&status=open**&page=<current issue page number>*&component=<Selected component>\\
_or_\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repository>/issues?status=new&status=open*&page=<current issue page number>**&responsible=<Selected Assignee>

Output:

# If the _<current issue page number>_ is equal and less than the total of filtered component pages, Bitbucket Cloud will display the filtered page.\\
*Attached Footage name*:\\
a.From the first page\\
b.Within filtered component page range
# If the _<current issue page number>_ is larger than the total of filtered component pages, Bitbucket Cloud *Returns Error 404*\\
*Attached Footage name*:\\
a. Returns Error 404

###Actual Results\\
Redirects to:\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repository>/issues?status=new&status=open&component=<Selected component>\\
_or_\\
https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repository>/issues?status=new&status=open&responsible=<Selected Assignee>

###Workaround

# Use *Advance Search* to filter component/assignee
# Remove *&page=<current issue page number>* from the weblink
fields.summary: Component/Assignee filter in Issue page redirects to an incorrect URL (BB-16164)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, setting the repository to have 'No Issue Tracker', doesn't remove any existing issues.\\
Repo admins may sometimes want to delete all issues from the issue tracker.\\
In case those issue are a lot, it's quite time consuming deleting them one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give repo admins the option to bulk-delete issues, or delete all issues in issue tracker.

h3. Workaround
# Delete issues one by one.
# Write a script that uses the [API|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/issues/%257Bissue_id%257D] to remove issues.
fields.summary: Customer Request - As a repo admin I want to be able to bulk-delete all issues from my issue tracker

fields.description:
I am using the API to trigger, check progress of, and download an issues export (as outlined here: https://gist.github.com/erikvanzijst/8851082).

Each time I trigger an export I get an email notification when the export is complete. I was hoping for a way to turn off these email notifications.

I tried turning off the various repository level and account wide notification options but they don't seem to control the issue export notifications. I also checked the documentation to see if there was an flag that could be passed to the issues export endpoint but didn't find anything (I checked https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/issues-resource-296095191.html).

I then contacted support and received the following response: "This seems to be an embedded system level notification that can't be turned off, from what I'm aware of. Anything that triggers a completed (or failed) export will be sent to your e-mail address." [BBS-34909]

Ideally, there would be a flag that can be passed to the API call so that the email notification can be controlled on a per export basis.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add option to turn off email notifications for issue exports

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I got 404 error on most of the servers i'm working on. i created a simple php code on the root  of my server and try to execute that when someone push on the repo. This php file set to write something on a log file. But it returns 404 on most of my servers. I suppose 404 mean the address provided for webhook are not available (which there is, it works via browser)\\
This is the details of request, is there anyway i can find what's the problem:

{code}
Response from http://www.mydomain.co.uk/write-to-file.php
HTTP status: 404
Elapsed time: 970ms
Request time: in a few seconds (Saturday, July 2nd 2016, 3:31:38 pm)
Headers
content-length	0
via	1.1 util-102.ash1.bb-inf.net (squid/3.3.8)
x-cache	MISS from util-102.ash1.bb-inf.net
set-cookie	_icl_current_language=en; expires=Sun, 03-Jul-2016 11:01:37 GMT; path=/, _icl_current_language=en; expires=Sun, 03-Jul-2016 11:01:38 GMT; path=/
x-cache-lookup	MISS from util-102.ash1.bb-inf.net:8080

fields.summary: Webhooks return 404 on some servers

fields.description:
Hi,

Today i merged a pull request, but have found that merged result is different than i expected.

My repository: https://bitbucket.org/dismine/valentina\\
Source repository: https://bitbucket.org/ValentinaZhuravska/valentina\\
The pull request: https://bitbucket.org/dismine/valentina/pull-requests/131/fixed-issue-522/diff

We use mercurial. And before i never close source branch, but this time i decided to do it.\\
Also we do not use unique branch name for each new feature. If someone add new feature it use named branch "feature". Then merge it with my "develop" branch.

This time some how bitbucket ignored data from pull request, closed already merged branch and merged it again.
fields.summary: Wrong branch was merged.

fields.description:
When I push a commit sometimes that new code comes with a bunch of new tasks. I know if you reference an existing issue with # before the issue number it will automatically create a link to that issue. I am thinking it would be awesome to somewhat reverse that logic.

Make it so that writing a commit message could look like this:

`

* Fixed failing logic statements for interface class ##+ISSUE: Docs team to update documentation to show new logic##\\
`

In my mind the ## could be used to parse some internal code that ultimately pulls that line out of the commit message (allowing commit messages to remain concise) and create a new issue in the issue tracker that can be further updated later by someone on the team. Maybe even place the new issue number in the commit message in place of where the actual issue line was.

To the developer the commit message would read as:

`

* Fixed failing logic statements for interface class. New issues: [#12345|link-to-issue-in-gui]\\
`
fields.summary: Create an issue from commit message using hashtags (or similar)

fields.description: If the main branch of a repo has branch permissions set, you can not edit the wiki of a repo if you do not have access to push to the main branch.  This is regardless of overall repo write, or admin access.
fields.summary: Unable to edit repository wiki with write permissions if main branch is restricted. (BB-16163)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users may often create different workspaces under their account, and at some point decide that they want to keep only one and move all the repositories to one workspace.

If the number of repos is large, it can be quite time consuming to transfer repos one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution
Proposing a feature to allow bulk transfer of repositories between workspaces.
fields.summary: Customer request - Bulk-transfer repositories between workspaces.
Markdown parser does not handle links with some special characters

!3596168970-merge.png|thumbnail!

!1359602081-error.png|thumbnail!

When build finished, send message to slack

fields.description: A build can not be stopped if the account has exceeded it's allowance. It seems to be using the same logic to disable the button as the rerun button.
fields.summary: Can not stop build if allowance exceeded

fields.description: Looks like we are caching the session token longer than its expire so the app switcher is correctly throwing up a 401 as it is invalid.
fields.summary: Appswitcher link causes logged in users to have to log in a second time to JIRA, and give a 401 error. (FUSE-4098)

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability to specify some shared steps which will always be executed. For instance we always want to load our submodules, lint the code and run the tests, regardless of branch.

However every time I add a new branch config I have to specify that manually and should we decided to change something in the common process that needs to be changed in several places.
fields.summary: Allow shared steps

fields.description: Having many Pull Requests or hooks in a repository can cause slowdowns on merges.
fields.summary: Slowdown on Merge PR (BB-16157)

fields.description:
BB will send an invalid XML document to pivotal if an XML characters (e.g. <>) is placed into a commit message. Same can be said for the username (if its possible to have XML characters). This means that commits with those characters will fail to update pivotal.

One of the big problems here is that most of our "Service" hooks are deprecated. We need the same functionality within our webhooks for use with Pivotal.
fields.summary: Pivotal Service hook sends invalid XML (BB-16159)

fields.description:
Sometimes users get accidentally added/invited to other repos or teams.

Suggestions by customer to avoid this issue:

Add an option to configure who can send invitations to my account, e.g. Everyone, Only Followers, No-one, etc.
fields.summary: Customer request - As a user I would like to have the option to configure who can send me repo/team invitations

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1 Create an issue on a public repository (which belongs to you) without logging in.

2 It will show "Watchers" as NONE.

3 Then log into your account, and load that issue page again.

4 Vote the issue.

5 Now the page shows Watchers as "NaN"

!3030122943-issuesNaN2.JPG|thumbnail!

Workaround: Refresh the page, and it will show correctly.
fields.summary: If users create an issue on a repository before logging in, issue's Watchers showing "NaN" after logging in. (BB-16155)

fields.description: We would like to run our pipeline build on a private docker hub repo.
fields.summary: Support private docker hub repositories

fields.description:
In a pull request I would like Bitbucket to automatically resolve merge conflicts on a specific file such that it always takes the version in the pull request. We have a release notes file that we update with each branch we deliver. We always want the version being delivered. Since it is always changing it often results in a merge conflict when two pull requests are happening at the same time.

In the .gittattributes file you can set a merge rule to override the default merge algorithm.  For example the following rule will always take the version from "our" branch if there is a conflict:

release_notes.txt merge=ours

This does not appear to be supported in Bitbucket cloud though.   Could it be?
fields.summary: Ability to automatically resolve merge conflicts

fields.description:
{{rake assets:precompile RAILS_ENV=production}} runs out of memory.

There is no easy way to make this task incremental, and it consumes a significant amount of RAM in the process. The current 2 GB limit is leaving us unable to build our Ruby on Rails project (Maven 3.3.9, JRuby 9.1.2.0, PostgreSQL 9.2). Experimentally, it looks like we're about 500 MB short, and the app is by no means notably large.

Either increasing the RAM limit across the board or making it configurable for different plans (perhaps some kind of EC2 inspired model of tiered build machines?) would change this from being unusable out of the gate.

{code}
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal ...precompile-assets (default-precompile-assets) on project [project]: precompile assets failed: precompile assets with command java -jar /root/.m2/repository/org/jruby/jruby-complete/9.1.2.0/jruby-complete-9.1.2.0.jar -S /opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build/athena/.gems/bin/rake assets:precompile RAILS_ENV=production failed with return code 137 -> [Help 1]
{code}

We're (relatively) happily using Bamboo now and are excited to jump over to Pipelines - when it can support our build of course.
fields.summary: Increase memory limit above 2GB or make it configurable

fields.description:
# Codeship shows previous logs

fields.summary: Look at Codeship and try to learn from them

fields.description:
When two different command keywords are used in a commit, it triggers two comments in the issue page instead.

Have a look at this screenshot where it has only one command keyword despite the issue number appearing twice - only one comment appears:

!1851368033-issuedupe1.JPG|thumbnail!

Now compare it to this screenshot where it has two command keywords - two comments appear:

!2781234667-issuedupe2.JPG|thumbnail!

The expected behavior should be that when one commit has more than one command keyword to a single issue, Bitbucket will _not_ add more than one comment into the issue's topic.
fields.summary: When one commit has more than one command keyword to a single issue, Bitbucket should not add more than one comment into the issue's topic.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1 Have same files from two different branches.

2 Do changes on them both differently and create PRs to be merged to the same branch:

!1853388507-branchPR1.JPG|thumbnail!\\
!86194736-brancPR2.JPG|thumbnail!

3 Merge one of the PR:

!3545856284-branchPR1merged.JPG|thumbnail!

4 The other PR knows there's a merge conflict now, but it is not showing the changes:

!975279885-branchPR2merge.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Files changed" is shown as (0) for a PR when 2 PRs is created with the exact same file from different branches and has different changes, and one of the PR is merged. (BB-16154)

fields.description:
Snippets that use Mercurial to version files cannot be cloned using HTTPS right now, even though UI suggests that everything should work fine.

Example: clicking on the Clone button for https://bitbucket.org/snippets/seanfarley/98ggg/hg-test-output and choosing HTTPS shows {{hg clone https://bitbucket.org/snippets/seanfarley/98ggg/hg-test-output}}. Doing that results in:

{code}
$ hg clone https://bitbucket.org/snippets/seanfarley/98ggg/hg-test-output
abort: HTTP Error 404: Not Found
{code}

At the same time, cloning that snippet with SSH works, but to distribute useful snippets it's obviously not an option, because it requires people to set up keys first.
fields.summary: Snippets backed by Mercurial cannot be cloned by HTTPS (404: Not Found) (BB-16165)

fields.description: Variables do not support having newline characters in them. Right now the work around is to use base-64 encoding instead, which removes the 'secured' functionality of a variable.
fields.summary: Provide support for new line characters in Bitbucket Pipelines variables

fields.description:
First time I have seen this error.\\
Pipelines has been working perfectly for us.

!908412477-2016-06-27%2012-56-14.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error retrieving variables

fields.description:
I have followed a million guides regarding this and I cannot get it to work. Earlier, I successfully pushed via SSH to my private Bitbucket git repository, now suddenly it wont work.

I have recreated the keys with a new passphrase, added it to my Bitbucket settings and it wont work.

Okay, here are the steps I took:

# Deleted old key pair (project1 and project1.pub)
# Recreated it with this command {{ssh-keygen -f ~/.ssh/project1 -C "project1"}}
# Created a {{config}} in {{~/.ssh}} file for my *two* Bitbucket accounts, with the following contents:

{code}
#!

Host project1
 HostName bitbucket.org
 IdentityFile ~/.ssh/project1
Host project2
 HostName bitbucket.org
 IdentityFile ~/.ssh/project2
{code}

# Grabbed the contents of {{project1.pub}} and created a new SSH key entry in my Bitbucket account.
# Added {{ssh-agent}} in my {{~/.zshrc}} plugin list like this: {{plugins=(git ssh-agent)}} and restarted Terminal
# Did {{ssh-add -l}} and saw only {{project2}} was loaded
# Did {{ssh-add ~/.ssh/project1}}, entered my passphrase and success, like this:

{code}
#!

2048 SHA256:THESHA256 /Users/myuser/.ssh/project2 (RSA)
2048 SHA256:THESHA256 /Users/myuser/.ssh/project1 (RSA)
{code}

# Restarted Terminal and did {{ssh-add -l}} and it listed both entries
# Went to my project and did {{git push}} and it told me I had no access.

----
When I do {{ssh -T git@bitbucket.com}}, it tells me I'm logged in with the username of *project2*.

bq. logged in as project2_user.


My system is *OS X 10.11.5*

I could never fix multiple identities on my computer and always used HTTPS, but I need to make everything more secure with SSH, which also allows my account to have two-factor authentication. Therefore using SSH is a must now and I don't know what to do.

P.S: I did the creating steps for the identity for *project2* too, but I'm fairly certain that it doesn't work either.

----
Guide I followed:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-multiple-ssh-identities-for-gitbash-mac-osx-linux-271943168.html

----
*project2* has no passphrase, while *project1* does! Just thought maybe this is relevant.
fields.summary: Can't SSH into my Bitbucket repository - conq: repository access denied

fields.description: It would be very helpful to have links for pull request comments. In the same way as with JIRA comments, where every comment has a small anchor icon to copy the link.
fields.summary: Add link to pull request comments

fields.description:
We deploy to different Elastic Beanstalk environments depending on the branch.  For example, we have a dev branch that gets deployed to a dev environment.

The global environment variables are very helpful but it would be extremely helpful to specify environment variables that apply ONLY for certain branches. The same logic used to match the pipelines branch could apply. So for example I could specify that APPLICATION_ENVIRONMENT should be "my_dev_environment" only if the branch starts with "dev".

BTW, we are working around this by overriding the ENV variables in the build script but it would be cleaner to maintain all ENV variables in the pipelines interface.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Branch-Specific Environment Variables

fields.description: Is it possible to detect R source files with .r extension correctly?
fields.summary: Detect R source code with lowercase extension .r

fields.description:
If the team name contains a space, the name shows up truncated on the team name input field on the settings page.

For example: Teams in Space will just show up as 'Teams'

The team name is showed correctly anywhere else on the site though

----
If you enter a name with spaces in  https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<team user_id> and click 'Update profile', the name shows up complete in that field.

However, if you navigate to another page and then go back to  https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<team user_id> again, then the name shows truncated.
fields.summary: Team name shows up truncated on the teams settings page if the team name contains a space (BB-16153)

fields.description:
Alice and Bob have both forked Candace's repo, leading to alice/foo and bob/foo as children of candace/foo. how can Alice, ideally using the web UI, send a pull request directly to Bob's fork rather than via the parent repo?

I'm running into this problem currently, where individual devs can't directly collaborate through their working repos without gumming up the parent repo.

I asked first on the irc channel approx 12 hours ago, and smf told me to raise it as an issue on site/master.
fields.summary: Direct pull requests between sibling repos

fields.summary: size of the repository showing wrong

As of now, every PR's commit message is set by default to this format:

!4292932643-default.JPG|thumbnail!

It's best if users have the ability to change/customize the format so that they can use the customized format every time without having to change it.
fields.summary: Ability to change/customize PR default commit message

fields.description: mIRC scripts are not being showed with the properly encoding. Actually, after you save those, they are showed as plain text instead of keep the mIRC encoding. This behaviour doesn’t happen using  Shell format, for instance.
fields.summary: mIRC snippets are being showed as plain text. (BB-16152)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Closed branch can't be found in Branch page.\\
If a branch is closed without a merge, it is hard to identify whether the error "A branch with this name already exists" while creating a Branch with the same name in Branch page is a valid error or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
provide an interface to see closed branches

h3. Workaround
# If you want to reopen a branch, you can try

#* Hg update on the closed branch, in your local repository
#* Do a commit on this branch, and then it should automatically reopen
#* If you push then your changes to Bitbucket, you should be able to see the develop branch.
# If you want to remove the branch, you can strip it, but that also means losing all the previous commit in the branch.\\
http://sandrotosi.blogspot.nl/2011/08/mercurial-how-to-completely-remove.html
fields.summary: Customer Request: View closed branch in Branch page

fields.description:
It will be useful if *Snippets* has the following buttons

# Download - Will download the code snippet with the <filename> as name
# Clipboard - will copy the whole code into clipboard

Example:\\
!3718679956-rc2xwiY.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Include Download and Clipboard button in Snippets

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I noted that Bitbucket UI allow only a "plain merge" instead of "git merge --no-ff".

As I know, the --no-ff flag causes the merge to always create a new commit object, even if the merge could be performed with a fast-forward. This avoids losing information about the historical existence of a feature branch and groups together all commits that together added the feature.

With a "plain merge", it is impossible to see from the Git history which of the commit objects together have implemented a feature—you would have to manually read all the log messages. Reverting a whole feature (i.e. a group of commits), is a true headache in the current situation, whereas it is easily done if the "--no-ff" flag was used.

Yes, it will create a few more (empty) commit objects, but the gain is much bigger than the cost.

Please, can you consdier to add ability for users to toggle merge type in BitBucket?

I merged some days ago my Develop branch to Master and with BitBucket merge I now find all previous develop commits into merge, while I thought to find only a final big commits on master.

Thank you
fields.summary: Ability to choose between "plain merge" or "git merge --no-ff"

fields.description:
I'm using Chrome.  Whenever I open the pipelines web ui I see the CPU usage jump.

When I open a specific build while in progress (where the build log is scrolling by), I hear the fan kick on after a few seconds.  I watch the process monitor and it seems to consume almost 100% of a CPU.

If I open a previously completed build, the cpu consumes almost 50%.  The same occurs on the screen where you list all the builds.
fields.summary: Pipelines Web UI Consumes too much CPU
